Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, three black lines; wall glazed; top of rim glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved, with band between; glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Although the sherd is not discussed by Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012), the sherd might belong to a variant of his Type 5C group of South Ionian cups with everted rims. The interior and exterior rim pattern decorations are not consistent with his Type 5C but the profile and remaining decoration do. Type 5C cups are amongst the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. This cup type coincides with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18) and Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 33, pl. 21, no. 9a-b) (incorrectly labelled 26.2.14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.076) (Phase 3)
